dialogue_blocks.speaker: Rosa
dialogue_blocks.context: Asking for a description of someone

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Pedro
dialogue_blocks.text: Es alto y delgado. Tiene el pelo negro y los ojos cafés.
dialogue_blocks.translation: He's tall and slim. He has black hair and brown eyes.
dialogue_blocks.ipa: [es ˈalto i ðelˈɣaðo ‖ ˈtjene el ˈpelo ˈneɣɾo i los ˈoxos kaˈfes]

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Rosa
dialogue_blocks.translation: And what is his personality like?

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Pedro
dialogue_blocks.text: Es muy simpático y divertido, pero a veces es un poco serio.
dialogue_blocks.translation: He's very friendly and fun, but sometimes he's a bit serious.
dialogue_blocks.ipa: [es ˈmuj simˈpatiko i diβeɾˈtiðo ‖ ˈpeɾo a ˈβeses es um ˈpoko ˈseɾjo]

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Rosa
dialogue_blocks.translation: Is he older or younger than you?

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Pedro
dialogue_blocks.text: Es tres años mayor. Él es el mayor de la familia.
dialogue_blocks.translation: He's three years older. He's the oldest in the family.
dialogue_blocks.ipa: [es ˈtɾes ˈaɲos maˈʝoɾ ‖ el es el maˈʝoɾ ðe la faˈmilja]
dialogue_blocks.context: Giving relative age and family position

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Rosa
dialogue_blocks.translation: How interesting! And what's his name?

dialogue_blocks.speaker: Pedro
dialogue_blocks.text: Se llama Miguel. Es abogado — muy trabajador.
dialogue_blocks.translation: His name is Miguel. He's a lawyer — very hardworking.
dialogue_blocks.ipa: [se ˈʝama miˈɣel ‖ es aβoˈɣaðo ‖ ˈmuj tɾaβaxaˈðoɾ]

exercises.instruction: Escoge la forma correcta del adjetivo
exercises.question: María es muy _____ (trabajador — feminine form).

feedback.correct: ¡Correcto! Adjectives ending in -or add -a for feminine: trabajador → trabajadora.
feedback.incorrect: Remember adjective agreement: feminine singular needs -a at the end.

exercises.instruction: Une el adjetivo con su opuesto

speaking_rubric.title: Describe a alguien (Describe someone)
speaking_rubric.scenario: Your friend hasn't met your sibling. Describe them physically and by personality.
speaking_rubric.prompt: Describe a tu hermano o hermana: apariencia y personalidad.

sample_response.text: Mi hermana se llama Luisa. Es baja y tiene el pelo castaño. Es muy simpática e inteligente.
sample_response.ipa: [mi eɾˈmana se ˈʝama ˈlwisa ‖ es ˈbaxa i ˈtjene el ˈpelo kasˈtaɲo ‖ es ˈmuj simˈpatika e inteliˈxente]

cultural_notes.formality: In Mexico, physical descriptions are generally given openly and without discomfort. Terms like 'gordito/a' (chubby) are used as affectionate diminutives, not insults. Context and tone are everything.
cultural_notes.gestures: Mexicans often gesture at their own face or body to indicate where a feature is when describing someone — pointing to eyes for eye color, height with a hand level.
cultural_notes.regional_variations: In Mexico, 'café' is the standard word for brown eyes — not 'marrón' as in Spain. 'Moreno/a' (dark-complexioned) is a common, neutral descriptor in Mexico.
